articles.summary: 87% of Americans think foreign governments will use artificial intelligence to attack the U.S. in the next two decades. 41% think AI will leave the country worse off, while 37% think it will be better for national security. The youngest age groups are the most critical of the technology, with 46% of both 18- to 29-year-olds and 30- to 39-years-old saying it would be worse for the country. Women, Democrats and non-AI users are more likely to rate AI negatively. Americans are slightly more skeptical about the development of AI weapons.

articles.title: Sonrai Security Introduces WALLy: The First AI Agent That Safely Fixes Cloud Privilege Risk
articles.summary: Sonrai Security has launched WALLy, an AI security agent for Cloud Privilege Access Management (PAM). It's the first AI agent designed to fix privilege risk, not just identify it. It automatically removes unnecessary privileges, enforces just-in-time access, and blocks risky privileges across humans, machines, AI agents, and third parties. Every action is staged for human approval, protected by guardrails and fully audited. It will be generally available in Q4 for all Sonrai Cloud Permissions Firewall customers.
